qas.question: Which kingdom did the Chola navy attack during the 11th century?
What was the capital of Srivijaya kingdom?
Which king of Kedah converted to Islam in the year 1267?
Name an Indonesian Islamic scholar who lived from 1908-1981?
Which Chinese admiral was related to the development of Islam in Indonesia & Malaya?

plausible_answers.text: a turbulent period occurred in the history of Maritime Southeast Asia

qas.question: Who did the Srivijaya kingdom attack?
What happened to the king of Chola?
What kig converted from Islam in 1267?

context: In the 11th century, <b5_0>a turbulent period occurred in the history of Maritime Southeast Asia<b5_0/>. The Indian <b6_0>Chola<b6_0/> navy crossed the ocean and attacked the <a0_0>Srivijaya kingdom<a0_0/> of <a1_0>Sangrama Vijayatungavarman<a1_0/> in Kadaram (Kedah), the capital of the powerful maritime kingdom was sacked and the king was <b7_0>taken captive<b7_0/>. Along with Kadaram, Pannai in present-day Sumatra and Malaiyur and the Malayan peninsula were attacked too. Soon after that, the king of Kedah <a2_0><b8_0>Phra Ong Mahawangsa<b8_0/><a2_0/> became the first ruler to abandon the traditional Hindu faith, and converted to Islam with the Sultanate of Kedah established in year 1136. Samudera Pasai converted to Islam in the year 1267, the King of Malacca Parameswara married the princess of Pasai, and the son became the first sultan of Malacca. Soon, Malacca became the center of Islamic study and maritime trade, and other rulers followed suit. Indonesian religious leader and Islamic scholar <a3_0><b9_0>Hamka<b9_0/><a3_0/> (1908–1981) wrote in 1961: "The development of Islam in Indonesia and Malaya is intimately related to a Chinese Muslim, <a4_0>Admiral Zheng He<a4_0/>."
